refnamediv.refpurpose: set the "machine" environment variables from the dynamic values

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: machineenv is a chain-loading utility that sets environment variables and then chain loads to next-prog with the execvp3 function.
next-prog may contain its own command line options, which machineenv will ignore.

The following environment variables are set:
MACHINEID
Set to the human-readable hexadecimal non-punctuated form of the machine ID, for details on which see setup-machine-id1.
HOSTNAME
Set to the dynamic "host" name, as initialized by set-dynamic-hostname1 (for example) and obtained by the gethostname2 function.
DOMAINNAME
Set to the dynamic "domain" name, as obtained by the getdomainname2 function.

refsection.title: BUGS
refsection.para: Although not strictly a bug in this program, it is worth noting that the GNU C library and the BSD C library both have memory leaks in their setenv3 and unsetenv3 functions, used by this program. You can work around these bugs by ensuring that next-prog is not a built-in command (see exec1).
